summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to FirstBank Puerto Rico, dated December 31, 2019, with a return date of January 15, 2020. It demands extensive financial records related to Jeffrey Epstein and LSJE LLC from January 1, 2005, onward, as part of a criminal investigation into violations including sex trafficking and conspiracy. The document includes a detailed rider listing 27 categories of requested records and a request for non-disclosure to preserve the investigation's confidentiality.

keyFacts: The subpoena is part of an ongoing grand jury investigation into alleged violations of federal criminal law, specifically citing statutes 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c), 2422(b) (coercion and enticement), and 371 (conspiracy).
It demands a comprehensive set of financial records from FirstBank Puerto Rico related to Jeffrey Epstein and LSJE LLC covering the period from January 1, 2005, to the present (as of December 2019).

The U.S. Attorney's Office explicitly requests that the bank not disclose the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation and prevent interference.

The requested records include 27 detailed categories, covering account statements, signature cards, wire transfers, loan files, currency transaction reports, correspondence, surveillance video, and corporate documents.
The document shows the investigation into Epstein's financial activities was active and seeking detailed bank records in late 2019, after Epstein's death in August 2019.
